string-array.name: PlacemanaliDescription
string-array.item: Solang Valley is a picturesque valley known for its stunning landscapes and adventure activities like paragliding and skiing. It is a popular destination for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.
Hidimba Devi Temple is an ancient cave temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, a character from the Mahabharata. The temple is surrounded by cedar forests and has a unique architectural style.
Rohtang Pass is a high mountain pass that connects Manali to Lahaul and Spiti. It offers breathtaking views of the Himalayas and is a gateway to many adventure activities, including snow sports.
Manu Temple is dedicated to the sage Manu and is believed to be the only temple of Manu in India. It is situated in Old Manali and offers a tranquil atmosphere for spiritual seekers.
Old Manali is known for its charm and vibrant atmosphere. It has narrow lanes, traditional houses, and a bohemian vibe. The area is popular for its cafes, shops, and cultural experiences.

string-array.name: PlacemanaliAddress

string-array.name: PlaceudaipurDescription
string-array.item: City Palace is a magnificent palace complex on the banks of Lake Pichola. It showcases a blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architectural styles and offers panoramic views of the city and lake.

Lake Pichola is an artificial freshwater lake created in 1362 AD. It is surrounded by hills, palaces, temples, and bathing ghats. Boat rides on Lake Pichola are popular for enjoying the scenic beauty.

Jag Mandir is an island palace on Lake Pichola. It is known for its elegant architecture and beautiful gardens. The island provides a peaceful retreat with stunning views of the surrounding landscapes.

Saheliyon Ki Bari, or the Garden of the Maidens, is a beautiful garden adorned with fountains, kiosks, marble elephants, and a delightful lotus pool. It was designed as a relaxing spot for royal women.

Jagdish Temple is a large and artistically significant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. It is an architectural marvel with intricate carvings and sculptures, attracting devotees and tourists alike.

string-array.name: PlaceudaipurAddress
string-array.item: Jag Mandir, Lake Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan, India
Saheliyon Ki Bari, Udaipur, Rajasthan, India

string-array.name: PlacegoaDescription
string-array.item: Basilica of Bom Jesus is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a famous church in Goa. It holds the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier and is known for its Baroque architecture.
Calangute Beach is the largest and one of the most popular beaches in North Goa. It attracts tourists with its golden sand, water sports, and vibrant nightlife.
Fort Aguada is a well-preserved 17th-century Portuguese fort in Goa. It offers panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and is a popular tourist destination.
Dudhsagar Waterfalls is a majestic four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River. It is surrounded by lush greenery and is a spectacular natural attraction.
Anjuna Beach is known for its vibrant and bohemian atmosphere. It is famous for its weekly flea market, water sports, and beach parties.

string-array.name: PlacegoaAddress
string-array.item: Basilica of Bom Jesus, Old Goa, Goa, India
Calangute Beach, North Goa, Goa, India
Anjuna Beach, North Goa, Goa, India

string-array.name: PlacekashmirDescription
string-array.item: Dal Lake is a picturesque freshwater lake in Srinagar, surrounded by mountains and Mughal gardens. It is known for its shikara rides and houseboats, creating a serene and romantic atmosphere.

Gulmarg is a popular hill station and ski resort known for its snow-capped mountains and lush green meadows. It offers breathtaking views of the Himalayas and is a haven for winter sports enthusiasts.
Shalimar Bagh is one of the Mughal Gardens in Srinagar, designed by Emperor Jahangir. It features terraced lawns, flowing water, and vibrant flower beds, reflecting the Mughal style of garden design.

Pari Mahal is a historic monument perched on a hilltop, offering panoramic views of Srinagar and the Dal Lake. It was once a Buddhist monastery and later converted into a school of astrology by Dara Shikoh.
Shankaracharya Temple, also known as the Jyeshteshwara temple, is situated on a hilltop and dedicated to Lord Shiva. It provides a commanding view of Srinagar and the surrounding areas.

string-array.name: PlacemumbaiDescription
string-array.item: The Gateway of India is an iconic monument and a popular tourist attraction in Mumbai. It was built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to Mumbai.
Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, formerly known as Victoria Terminus, is a historic railway station known for its architectural brilliance. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Marine Drive is a picturesque promenade along the Arabian Sea. It is known for its stunning views, especially during sunset, and is a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike.
Haji Ali Dargah is a mosque and tomb located on an islet in the Arabian Sea. It is a revered religious site and a symbol of Mumbai\'s rich cultural heritage.
Elephanta Caves are ancient rock-cut caves dedicated to Lord Shiva. They are located on Elephanta Island and showcase impressive sculptures and architecture.

string-array.name: PlacedelhiDescription
string-array.item: India Gate is a war memorial and an iconic landmark in Delhi. It stands tall as a tribute to the soldiers who sacrificed their lives in World War I.
Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tallest brick minaret in the world. It is a symbol of Indo-Islamic architecture and Delhi\'s historical richness.
Humayun\'s Tomb is a majestic garden tomb that is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun and a masterpiece of Mughal architecture.
Lotus Temple is a Bahá\'í House of Worship known for its stunning lotus-like design. It is open to people of all religions and is a peaceful place for meditation and reflection.
Red Fort, also known as Lal Qila, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a historic fort in Delhi. It served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors for nearly 200 years.
